title: Sharing Life Experiences
description: Practice talking about your experiences, achievements, and life changes.

sentences.text: I've had many interesting experiences in my life.
sentences.translation: 저는 인생에서 많은 흥미로운 경험을 했어요.

sentences.text: Have you ever traveled to a foreign country alone?
sentences.translation: 혼자 외국 여행을 해본 적이 있나요?
sentences.tips: 'Have you ever'로 시작해서 끝을 올려 의문문 억양을 살리세요.

sentences.text: I've learned a lot from my mistakes over the years.
She has overcome many challenges to get where she is today.
sentences.translation: 그녀는 오늘날의 위치에 오르기까지 많은 도전을 극복했어요.

sentences.text: I've always wanted to learn how to play the piano.
sentences.translation: 저는 항상 피아노 치는 법을 배우고 싶었어요.

sentences.text: What's the most memorable experience you've ever had?
sentences.translation: 지금까지 가장 기억에 남는 경험이 뭐예요?

sentences.text: I've been working on this project for three months now.
He has achieved so much since he started his own business.
sentences.translation: 그는 사업을 시작한 이후로 정말 많은 것을 이루었어요.

sentences.text: I've never regretted my decision to study abroad.
sentences.translation: 저는 유학하기로 한 결정을 한 번도 후회한 적이 없어요.

sentences.text: Have you made any important decisions recently?
sentences.translation: 최근에 중요한 결정을 내린 적이 있나요?

sentences.text: This experience has completely changed my perspective on life.
sentences.translation: 이 경험은 제 인생관을 완전히 바꿔놓았어요.

sentences.text: I've grown a lot as a person since I moved to this city.
sentences.translation: 이 도시로 이사 온 이후로 저는 사람으로서 많이 성장했어요.

dialoguePractice.title: Catching Up with an Old Friend

lines.text: Jordan! It's been ages! How have you been?
Alex! I've been great. So much has happened since we last met.
Really? Tell me about it! Have you changed jobs?
Yes! I've just started working at a tech company. It's been challenging but rewarding.
That sounds exciting. Have you traveled anywhere interesting?
Actually, I've been to Japan twice this year. It was an incredible experience.
Wow! I've always wanted to go there. What was the highlight?
Definitely climbing Mount Fuji. It was the most challenging thing I've ever done.
That's amazing. I've never done anything that adventurous.
You should try it! It really changed my perspective on what I'm capable of.

items: Did you pronounce Present Perfect contractions naturally (I've, you've, he's)?
Did you use rising intonation for questions with 'Have you ever...?'
Did you stress key words to emphasize meaning?
Did you speak at a natural, flowing pace?
Did you speak without long pauses or hesitations?
Did you connect sentences smoothly using linking words?
Did you complete all sentences confidently?
Did you practice the dialogue with natural rhythm?
Did you use Present Perfect correctly for experiences?
Did you use correct past participle forms?
Did you distinguish between Present Perfect and Past Simple?
Could a listener understand your experiences clearly?
Did you express emotions and opinions naturally?
Did you sound engaged and interested?
Did you use appropriate vocabulary for describing experiences?
